intro: Aubletia ulmifolia, commonly known as the slender aubletia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are trifoliate, with each leaflet being oval-shaped and slightly hairy. Aubletia ulmifolia is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
